intro: Dichromena watsonii, commonly known as Watson's dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Dichromena watsonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
